description.narrative: The Project consists of A and C loan financing to Akenerji Elektrik Üretimi A.S. (Akenerji) to support five small scale hydropower projects under construction / development on Seyhan river basin and future potential power distribution projects pursued by AkEnerji. The Project cost for Akenerji to complete these five hydropower projects is $338 million. The proposed IFC investment consists of up to $ 65 million A loan and $10 million C loan to Akenerji.

The Projects development impact is as follows: (i) creating 160MW additional renewable energy for the country; (ii) supporting power sector reform by increasing the share of private generation in Turkey's overall electricity generation in order to move towards possible EU accession and the creation of a regional energy market; and (iii) leveraging IFC's experience in financing generation projects in deregulated markets. Through the above, the Project will positively impact the fiscal and macroeconomic stability of Turkey.

name.narrative: Akenerji is in the process of expanding its power generation capacity. In this proposed investment, IFCs loan is targeted to support 5 small scale hydropower plants under construction or development which are a part of this expansion plan, for which local authorities clearance and community support is confirmed. These sub-projects include Feke I 30MW, Feke II 70MW and Himmetli, Gokkaya and Saimbeyli 27MW, 30MW and 3MW respectively in Adana.
